color_page module

class color_page.ColorPage(main, name)[source]

Bases: TabPage

Provides an editor for the color table used by gdaldem color-relief

  1. Provides editing for colors and elevations including rescale, insert, and delete rows.

  2. Displays an elevation scaled sample of the color gradients

3) Provides a preview of gdaldem color-relief with current settings. Methods:

load(project)[source]

Load the color ramp file and update the display with its contents. Called when a new project is loaded

update_color_file(dropped_file)[source]

Import a color file to this project

Parameters:

dropped_file (str) – The file path of the file to add.

class color_page.ColorSampleWidget(color_ramp, height)[source]

Bases: QWidget

Widget to display color bands with gradients between elevation levels.

paintEvent(event)[source]

Draw the color bands on the widget.

Parameters:

event – The paint event.

scale_color_bands()[source]

Scale each color band proportionally to its elevation range.

This method calculates the parameters for rendering each color band, including its height and color gradient based on the elevation data. The result is used to create a visually accurate color gradient where each band represents a different elevation range.

Returns:

A list of tuples, each containing:

  • color gradient (str): The color representation for the band.

  • target_y (float): The vertical position where the band should start.

  • band_height (float): The height of the band, indicating the elevation range it

covers.

Return type:

list[tuple]

class color_page.ColorSettingsWidget(data_mgr)[source]

Bases: QWidget

Widget for editing elevation levels and colors and synchronizing changes to data_mgr

colors_updated

int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

Type:

pyqtSignal(*types, name

Type:

str = …, revision

delete_row()[source]

Delete the current row from the color table.

Populate the table with rows from the color data file.

insert_row()[source]

Insert a new row by interpolating elevation and colors.

on_color_update(idx, new_color)[source]

Update the color button and data for the given index.

on_elevation_update(row_idx)[source]

Update elevation data when UI changes and notify sample display.

open_color_picker(idx)[source]

Open color picker dialog and update data with result

rescale()[source]

Rescale the elevations for each row. The scale is calculated using the current max elevation vs new_max elevation and applying the scale to all rows.

undo()[source]

Undo - revert back to previous color settings
